headline: Republican Ohio Gov Mike DeWine tests positive for COVID-19
author: ASSOCIATED PRESS
sentences: The 75-year-old Republican said in an announcement late Friday he was diagnosed by his personal physician after experiencing mild symptoms such as a runny nose, head ache, body aches and a sore throat.
DeWine’s diagnosis comes just 18 days before Ohio’s May 3 primary, in which he faces two Republican challengers, and just eight days before former President Donald Trump plans an Ohio rally.
He had previous plans to attend a celebration of the 200th birthday of President Ulysses S. Grant, an Ohio native, on that day.
It was unclear whether his diagnosis would affect DeWine’s attendance at the rally, or if he would have attended in any case.
Those conflicting results came just before the governor was to meet with Trump, then the president, in Cleveland.
The governor’s office said First Lady Fran DeWine was experiencing no symptoms and has tested negative.
He said he is following the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention protocol and quarantining.
DeWine tested positive for COVID-19 once before, in 2020, before testing negative later the same day.
DeWine was administered a monoclonal antibody treatment, which is designed to fight the infection.
Both the governor and his wife have received two coronavirus vaccines and a booster.
Mike DeWine has tested positive for COVID-19.
